page.title: 01DUFTON-BRAMPTON BLOCK
page.content: In the NE of this block is a group of hills at the foot of the Pennines grazed by fell sheep & beef cattle & home to a variety of wild birds.A row of isolated farms & cottages nestle against the hills,overlooking the Eden Valley. Between here & the river lies Flakebridge Wood, once the pheasant shoot in Appleby Castle Estate, but sold to a timber merchant.The shooting rights are now separately owned. Some deciduous trees have gone & are replaced with fir. Various small mixed farms occupy the remaining land round the wood & towards the villages of Dufton & Brampton, growing what crops they need for their own stock. The scattered buildings are of local sandstoneor limestone. There is a disused sandstone Quarry in Dufton Ghyll,andvarious old limestone ones on the fell.
